## Purpose
Error class definitions for the Rich terminal formatting library. This module provides a hierarchy of custom exceptions for different types of console and rendering errors.

## Exception Hierarchy
- **ConsoleError (L1-2)**: Base exception class for general console operation failures
- **StyleError (L5-6)**: Base exception class for style-related errors
- **StyleSyntaxError (L9-10)**: Inherits from ConsoleError; raised when style formatting is malformed
- **MissingStyle (L13-14)**: Inherits from StyleError; raised when referencing non-existent styles
- **StyleStackError (L17-18)**: Inherits from ConsoleError; raised when style stack operations fail
- **NotRenderableError (L21-22)**: Inherits from ConsoleError; raised when attempting to render unsupported objects
- **MarkupError (L25-26)**: Inherits from ConsoleError; raised when markup syntax is invalid
- **LiveError (L29-30)**: Inherits from ConsoleError; raised during Live display operations
- **NoAltScreen (L33-34)**: Inherits from ConsoleError; raised when alternate screen mode is required but unavailable

## Architecture
- Two-tier inheritance: ConsoleError serves as primary base, StyleError as specialized base for style operations
- All exceptions follow Python's standard exception pattern with descriptive docstrings
- Error categories cover: styling, rendering, markup parsing, live updates, and terminal capabilities

## Dependencies
- Standard Python Exception class only
- No external imports required
